channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kroger Antitrust Case Could Open Up New Bag of M&A Possibilities
item.description: A victory for the Federal Trade Commission, set to conclude Tuesday, could pave the way for an Amazon buying spree.

item.title: How Microsoft’s dividend hike and new $60 billion buyback program stack up
item.description: Only three U.S. companies have ever announced buyback programs bigger than Microsoft’s latest — though the new dividend yield is still low relative to...

item.title: The Battle Brewing Over Blood Tests for Cancer
item.description: Positive results of a colon cancer study conducted by Exact Sciences prompt the CEO of competitor Guardant Health to publicly challenge his rival to a...

item.title: Deckers stock split takes hold and shares slip
item.description: Shares of Ugg and Hoka parent Deckers Outdoor Corp. are down Tuesday after the shoe company’s six-for-one stock split took hold.

item.title: Salesforce Needs to Sell Its Latest AI Vision
item.description: The cloud pioneer hopes AI agents make a splash at its Dreamforce conference and rejuvenate growth prospects.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock has room to run, but analysts see more upside for six chip makers
item.description: Analysts predict Micron’s stock could nearly double from here, while Marvell and AMD are other favored plays.

item.title: Consumers Have a Debt Problem: Not Enough of the Right Kind
item.description: The Federal Reserve’s next interest-rate decision could be a fateful one for many consumers and in turn for debates about the health of the American s...

item.title: ‘My mom still has his original will’: A few months before he died, my father went online and made a secret will, cutting off my mother. Can he do this?
item.description: “His new will leaves his estate to my two nieces, nephew, my sister and me.”

item.title: Where to Put Your Money When the Fed Cuts Rates
item.description: What lower rates mean for the trillions of dollars in CDs and high-yield savings accounts.

item.title: Slowing housing market is hurting this plumbing and HVAC distributor’s sales
item.description: Ferguson Enterprises’ stock was headed for a fall Tuesday, after the plumbing, HVAC and appliance products distributor missed quarterly revenue expect...
